meta.title: Programming Mystery Box: Backend Edition
meta.description: A generator focused on backend materials, algorithms, and architectural constraints.

fabric_inputs.name: Local: Downloads Folder
fabric_inputs.description: The physical folder on your machine.

fabric_inputs.name: API: OpenMeteo (Weather)
fabric_inputs.description: Free weather data, no key required.

fabric_inputs.name: Local: System Clipboard
fabric_inputs.description: Whatever is currently copied to your clipboard.

fabric_inputs.name: Local: A CSV File
fabric_inputs.description: Find a random CSV online (e.g., global population, coffee prices).

fabric_inputs.name: Local: Images Folder
fabric_inputs.description: A specific directory of photos on your computer.

fabric_inputs.name: User Input: Text (STDIN)
fabric_inputs.description: Direct typing from the user via command line pipe.

fabric_inputs.name: Local: System Processes
fabric_inputs.description: Current CPU/RAM usage or running tasks.

fabric_inputs.name: Web: HackerNews / Reddit
fabric_inputs.description: Read the front page of a news aggregator (via API or RSS).

fabric_inputs.name: Local: Git Repository
fabric_inputs.description: The commit history or file structure of a local project.

fabric_inputs.name: Time: The Calendar
fabric_inputs.description: Current date, time, holidays, or timestamps.

fabric_inputs.name: Local: Log Files
fabric_inputs.description: Parse a fake server log or your own system logs.

fabric_inputs.name: Web: Wikipedia
fabric_inputs.description: Fetch a random article or summary.

fabric_inputs.name: API: Cat/Dog Facts
fabric_inputs.description: Simple text-based APIs returning animal trivia.

fabric_inputs.name: API: IP Geolocation
fabric_inputs.description: Where is the user currently located?

fabric_inputs.name: Local: Browser History
fabric_inputs.description: Export your history to JSON/CSV and use that.

fabric_inputs.name: API: REST Countries
fabric_inputs.description: Data about every country (flags, currency, pop).

fabric_inputs.name: User Input: Voice
fabric_inputs.description: Record a snippet of audio from the mic.

fabric_inputs.name: API: Agify/Genderize
fabric_inputs.description: Predict age/gender based on a name.

fabric_inputs.name: Local: Code Files
fabric_inputs.description: Scan a directory for .py or .js files.

fabric_inputs.name: Web: A Specific URL
fabric_inputs.description: Scrape a specific static webpage (e.g., your personal site).

fabric_inputs.name: Local: Todo List
fabric_inputs.description: A simple .txt file with line-separated tasks.

fabric_inputs.name: Local: Battery Status
fabric_inputs.description: Laptop battery percentage and charging state.

fabric_inputs.name: Web: RSS Feed
fabric_inputs.description: Any RSS feed (BBC, heavily used blogs).

fabric_inputs.name: Local: JSON Config
fabric_inputs.description: Create a complex JSON settings file to parse.

fabric_inputs.name: API: TV Maze
fabric_inputs.description: TV show schedules and episode info.

fabric_inputs.name: Local: Duplicate Files
fabric_inputs.description: Simulate a folder with duplicate files.

fabric_inputs.name: Web: Robots.txt
fabric_inputs.description: Parse the robots.txt of a famous site.

fabric_inputs.name: Local: Font Files
fabric_inputs.description: Analyze .ttf or .otf files in a folder.

fabric_inputs.name: Local: Network Interface
fabric_inputs.description: Your local IP, MAC address, connection status.

fabric_inputs.name: Local: Zip/Tar Files
fabric_inputs.description: Read contents inside a compressed archive.

fabric_inputs.name: System: Uptime
fabric_inputs.description: How long has the computer been on?

fabric_inputs.name: Local: CSV (Financial)
fabric_inputs.description: Download your own bank statement csv.

fabric_inputs.name: API: Deck of Cards
fabric_inputs.description: Shuffling and dealing card logic via API.

fabric_inputs.name: Local: WiFi Networks
fabric_inputs.description: Scan for available SSIDs (if OS permits).

fabric_inputs.name: API: YesOrNo
fabric_inputs.description: Returns a gif of yes or no.

fabric_inputs.name: API: Universalis
fabric_inputs.description: Final Fantasy XIV market board data.

fabric_inputs.name: Local: Installed Apps
fabric_inputs.description: List of software installed on OS.

fabric_inputs.name: Local: Temp Files
fabric_inputs.description: The contents of the /tmp or %TEMP% folder.

fabric_inputs.name: Wildcard
fabric_inputs.description: Combine TWO other inputs from this list.

notions_constraints.name: Regular Expressions (Regex)
notions_constraints.description: You must use heavy string pattern matching.

notions_constraints.name: Vector Math / Geometry
notions_constraints.description: The logic must rely on coordinates, distances, or angles.

notions_constraints.name: Fuzzy Logic / Matching
notions_constraints.description: The code must handle 'approximate' or messy matches.

notions_constraints.name: Web Sockets / Realtime
notions_constraints.description: Data must flow instantly, no refreshing allowed.

notions_constraints.name: Markov Chains
notions_constraints.description: Use probability to generate new data based on the old.

notions_constraints.name: Audio Synthesis / Processing
notions_constraints.description: The app must manipulate or generate sound waves.

notions_constraints.name: Image Processing (Backend)
notions_constraints.description: Resize, crop, or analyze images without a GUI.

notions_constraints.name: Cryptography / Hashing
notions_constraints.description: Data must be encrypted, hashed, or signed.

notions_constraints.name: Graph Theory
notions_constraints.description: Treat the data as Nodes and Edges (connections).

notions_constraints.name: Physics Simulation
notions_constraints.description: Items must have gravity, velocity, or collision.

notions_constraints.name: Steganography
notions_constraints.description: Hide secrets inside the data.

notions_constraints.name: Natural Language Processing
notions_constraints.description: Analyze sentiment, grammar, or word frequency.

notions_constraints.name: Genetic Algorithm
notions_constraints.description: Evolve the solution over multiple 'generations'.

notions_constraints.name: Cellular Automata
notions_constraints.description: Use grid-based rules (like Conway's Game of Life).

notions_constraints.name: ASCII Art Generation
notions_constraints.description: Visuals must be rendered using text characters.

notions_constraints.name: Speech-to-Text / TTS
notions_constraints.description: Interaction must be auditory, not just visual.

notions_constraints.name: Data Compression
notions_constraints.description: The goal is to make the footprint as small as possible.

notions_constraints.name: Pathfinding (A*)
notions_constraints.description: Find the shortest or most efficient route.

notions_constraints.name: Fractals / Recursion
notions_constraints.description: The code must be self-referential or recursive.

notions_constraints.name: OCR (Optical Character Rec)
notions_constraints.description: Read text from pixel data.

notions_constraints.name: Bitwise Operations
notions_constraints.description: Manipulate data at the binary level (AND, OR, XOR).

notions_constraints.name: Machine Learning (Simple)
notions_constraints.description: Use a basic classifier (k-NN) or regression.

notions_constraints.name: State Machine
notions_constraints.description: Strictly define states (Idle, Active, Error) and transitions.

notions_constraints.name: Headless Browser
notions_constraints.description: Automate a web browser without a visible UI.

notions_constraints.name: Multi-threading / Async
notions_constraints.description: Do multiple things at the exact same time.

notions_constraints.name: Frequency Analysis
notions_constraints.description: Analyze how often events/items occur.

notions_constraints.name: Particle System
notions_constraints.description: Generate many small moving parts.

notions_constraints.name: Queue / Stack
notions_constraints.description: Strictly follow First-In-First-Out or Last-In-First-Out.

notions_constraints.name: Caching / Memoization
notions_constraints.description: Optimize for speed by remembering past results.

notions_constraints.name: Procedural Generation
notions_constraints.description: Build the content via random algorithm.

notions_constraints.name: Terminal User Interface (TUI)
notions_constraints.description: Build a GUI, but strictly inside the terminal.

notions_constraints.name: Plugin Architecture
notions_constraints.description: The core code must be extendable by external scripts.

notions_constraints.name: Undo / Redo History
notions_constraints.description: Implement a command pattern to travel through time.

notions_constraints.name: Internationalization
notions_constraints.description: Must support multiple languages/formats from the start.

notions_constraints.name: Strict Typing
notions_constraints.description: Code must pass strict static type checking.

notions_constraints.name: Error Recovery
notions_constraints.description: The program must never crash, even on bad input.

notions_constraints.name: P2P / Mesh
notions_constraints.description: Nodes communicate directly without a central server.

notions_constraints.name: Virtual File System
notions_constraints.description: Treat data as if it were a folder structure.

notions_constraints.name: Exif / Metadata
notions_constraints.description: Focus on the hidden data attached to files.

notions_constraints.name: Calendar / Scheduling Math
notions_constraints.description: Complex date logic (recurring events, timezones).

notions_constraints.name: Hex / Binary Dump
notions_constraints.description: View the raw bytes of the content.

notions_constraints.name: Sentiment Analysis
notions_constraints.description: Is the content happy, sad, or angry?

notions_constraints.name: Rate Limiting
notions_constraints.description: Artificially restrict how fast the code runs.

notions_constraints.name: Unit Testing
notions_constraints.description: Write the tests FIRST, then the code.

notions_constraints.name: Command Line Arguments
notions_constraints.description: Must be fully controllable via flags.

notions_constraints.name: Obfuscation
notions_constraints.description: Make the output intentionally hard to reverse engineer.

notions_constraints.name: Diffing Algorithm
notions_constraints.description: Highlight exactly what changed between two states.

notions_constraints.name: Wildcard: Dual Wield
notions_constraints.description: Roll two Notions and combine them.

architecture_scenarios.name: Serverless / FaaS
architecture_scenarios.description: Must run as a stateless function with 500ms timeout.

architecture_scenarios.name: Offline-First
architecture_scenarios.description: Must work 100% without internet, syncing when back online.

architecture_scenarios.name: Microservices
architecture_scenarios.description: Split the logic into at least two distinct communicating processes.

architecture_scenarios.name: Event-Driven
architecture_scenarios.description: No direct function calls; everything triggers via Pub/Sub events.

architecture_scenarios.name: High Availability Simulation
architecture_scenarios.description: Assume any part of the system can crash at any time; handle it.

architecture_scenarios.name: Low Bandwidth Mode
architecture_scenarios.description: Optimize for minimal data transfer (simulate 2G connection).

architecture_scenarios.name: CLI Pipe (Unix Philosophy)
architecture_scenarios.description: No UI. Input from STDIN, output to STDOUT. Chainable.

architecture_scenarios.name: Zero Trust Security
architecture_scenarios.description: Authenticate/Validate every single request or data packet.

architecture_scenarios.name: Containerized
architecture_scenarios.description: The final deliverable must be a Docker container.

architecture_scenarios.name: Legacy Integration
architecture_scenarios.description: Pretend you have to output data to a format from 1998 (e.g., XML/Mainframe).

architecture_scenarios.name: High Concurrency
architecture_scenarios.description: Simulate handling 1000 requests per second.

architecture_scenarios.name: Distributed System
architecture_scenarios.description: Simulate data sharding across multiple 'nodes'.

architecture_scenarios.name: Background Daemon
architecture_scenarios.description: Runs silently in the background, waking up only on triggers.

architecture_scenarios.name: Plugin-Based Core
architecture_scenarios.description: Build a tiny core; all features must be added as plugins.

architecture_scenarios.name: Read-Heavy Optimization
architecture_scenarios.description: Optimize for fast reading (Caching, Indexing).

architecture_scenarios.name: Write-Heavy Optimization
architecture_scenarios.description: Optimize for fast ingestion (Logging, Streams).

architecture_scenarios.name: Multi-Tenant
architecture_scenarios.description: The system must handle multiple users completely isolated from each other.

architecture_scenarios.name: Stateless
architecture_scenarios.description: The app must not remember anything between runs (pure function).

architecture_scenarios.name: Air-Gapped
architecture_scenarios.description: No external APIs allowed. You must mock or bundle everything.

architecture_scenarios.name: Self-Healing
architecture_scenarios.description: The system detects its own errors and attempts to fix them.

architecture_scenarios.name: Job Queue / Worker
architecture_scenarios.description: User submits a task, a separate 'worker' processes it later.

architecture_scenarios.name: Twelve-Factor App
architecture_scenarios.description: Strict adherence to 12-factor config and statelessness.

architecture_scenarios.name: Edge Computing
architecture_scenarios.description: Simulate logic running on a low-power device (e.g., Raspberry Pi).

architecture_scenarios.name: CQRS
architecture_scenarios.description: Command Query Responsibility Segregation (Read and Write paths separate).

architecture_scenarios.name: Immutable Infrastructure
architecture_scenarios.description: Once data/config is written, it cannot be changed, only replaced.

architecture_scenarios.name: API-First
architecture_scenarios.description: Write the Swagger/OpenAPI spec before writing a single line of code.

architecture_scenarios.name: GraphQL
architecture_scenarios.description: Expose all data via a single graph endpoint.

architecture_scenarios.name: gRPC / Protobuf
architecture_scenarios.description: Use strict schema-based communication.

architecture_scenarios.name: Webhooks Receiver
architecture_scenarios.description: The app does nothing until it receives an HTTP POST hook.

architecture_scenarios.name: Log-Centric Audit
architecture_scenarios.description: The primary output is a secured, unalterable audit log.

architecture_scenarios.name: Cross-Platform
architecture_scenarios.description: Must run identically on Windows and Linux (file paths, separators).

architecture_scenarios.name: Resource Constrained
architecture_scenarios.description: Simulate a memory limit (e.g., must run in < 50MB RAM).

architecture_scenarios.name: Hypermedia (HATEOAS)
architecture_scenarios.description: API responses must include links to valid next actions.

architecture_scenarios.name: Data Pipeline (ETL)
architecture_scenarios.description: Extract, Transform, Load. Move data from A to B cleanly.

architecture_scenarios.name: Stream Processing
architecture_scenarios.description: Process data point-by-point in real-time, no bulk loading.

architecture_scenarios.name: Monolithic
architecture_scenarios.description: All logic must live in one single, large file/class.

architecture_scenarios.name: Database-per-Service
architecture_scenarios.description: Data components must have strict boundaries.

architecture_scenarios.name: Chaos Engineering
architecture_scenarios.description: Introduce random failures intentionally during execution.

architecture_scenarios.name: Wildcard: Dual Wield
architecture_scenarios.description: Roll two Architectures and force them to coexist.
